meanings.definition: To remove from a tribe or tribal society.
meanings.sent1: The government's policy was to detribalize the indigenous people and integrate them into mainstream society.
meanings.sent2: The missionary worked to detribalize the remote tribe and introduce them to modern ways of living.
meanings.sent3: The young man joked that his friends were trying to detribalize him by convincing him to switch football teams.
meanings.sent4: The new school curriculum aimed to detribalize the students by promoting unity and diversity.
meanings.sent5: The powerful speech by the leader inspired the nation to detribalize and come together as one community.

meanings.definition: To cause to lose tribal characteristics or affiliations.
meanings.sent1: The urban lifestyle can detribalize individuals by distancing them from their cultural roots.
meanings.sent2: Globalization has the potential to detribalize traditional communities by introducing new ideas and values.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer's bold collection aimed to detribalize the concept of tribal fashion.
meanings.sent4: The rapid development of technology can detribalize societies by breaking down traditional barriers.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist undergoes a journey to detribalize and find his own identity beyond his tribal heritage.
